author: Special Correspondent
text:
The city police have busted a flesh trade racket involving a school-going girl and arrested 12 persons including a police constable and a TNSTC driver.

The Commissioner of Police, Shailesh Kumar Yadav, said that acting on a specific tip off, a special team of police arrested the accused, including four women, who forced the girl into flesh trade. The girl, now 16 years old, had been sexually exploited by many persons for the last two years,” Mr. Yadav told reporters here on Sunday.

According to the Commissioner, the accused had exploited the acute poverty in the victim’s family after the girl’s father deserted them. “She is the 9{+t}{+h}child in the family. Many of them were married off. The crime is suspected to have taken place with the knowledge of the mother,” he said. However, Mr. Yadav said that only during the investigation the role of the mother would be known. The girl, who was studying class IX in a city school, was regular to classes. The girl had not shared her plight with any of her friends in school or with the teachers. The girl was threatened and lured into prostitution by the flesh trade operators and two brothers, Thangapandi and Sundarapandi. The police have also arrested the manager of a lodge in West Perumal Maistry Street, Xavier, the police constable, Prabhakaran of Tamil Nadu Special Police, and two others Syed Ali and, Prasannajith, for sexual exploitation.

Mr. Yadav said the accused were booked under the provisions of the Prevention of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. The incident comes close on the heels of a similar complaint of a girl in Sivaganga who was allegedly sexually exploited by several persons, including her close relatives and some policemen.
title: Schoolgirl forced into flesh trade in Madurai
